Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Alison R
Reviews.Content: Suite Oriani is exactly as described. It is a very comfortable guest house in an upmarket residential area of Rome only 5 minutes from the Metro with lots of restaurants close at hand. There is no bar, no restaurant but this makes for a very peaceful stay. Breakfast is charmingly served in your bedroom. The rooms are individual and extremely comfortable & Alessandro, his parents & staff are welcoming hosts. We will certainly go back to Suite Oriani when we next visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Oriani-- Superb!”
Reviews.Author: BerlinMMT
Reviews.Content: Suite Oriani is a lovely B&B-- the room was so clean, the bathroom was modern, the breakfast was delicious. They prepared a special breakfast meal for my gluten free dietary needs. The staff and owners are very friendly, helpful, and generous. The bed was very comfortable. Staying there made my business affairs in Rome less stressful. This is where I will stay when I return to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: LMM1991
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the best hotels we've stayed at. In reality it's almost and B&B...wonderful breakfast delivered to your room. Very nice room, wonderfully decorated and clean. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Only real drawback is the location...about 8-10 minute walk to the metro station. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value for Rome, but far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: DP301
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was close to a meeting that I had to attend. The room was large and comfortable, the staff was friendly and it was in a very quiet area. Although it is quite far from tourist attractions, the staff did a great job outlining where everything was and how to get there and even had some excellent restaurant recommendations for the area. The biggest drawback is the location, but everything else, including breakfast that is brought to your room, was great.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: KP58
Reviews.Content: This place is an absolute gem. We were attending a conference at the nearby auditorium and this place was well-placed, reasonably priced and highly-rated by guests. We booked 4 rooms and were absolutely delighted- and the envy of all our colleagues who paid much more for poorer quality accommodation. The area is a wonderful upscale neighbourhood- out of the centre which is a plus but well-served by public transport- we left the centre at midnight one evening and were at Oriani 20 minutes later (taxi fare about 12 euros). The rooms are slightly different in size- mine was on the ground floor and enormous with a little veranda, high ceiling, walk-in wardrobe and tastefully-furnished throughout. Breakfast is served in your room between 8 and 10 although they can manage slightly earlier or later if you need it. As we were a group we'd have preferred to eat together but there was no communal place to have breakfast. No big deal though and breakfast in your room particularly if a couple is a wonderful treat. Bruno, Alessandro and Vittoria are totally charming and extermely helpful. Our booked taxi to take us back to the airport let us down and Bruno drove us in his own car- it was more expensive than we would have paid but we really felt rescued and extermely grateful. I have been to Rome several times and have enjoyed almost every place I've stayed- but this place really is the best- I won't look for anywhere else (particularly if I can get the room I had this time!)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaTraveler
Reviews.Content: All in all I very much enjoyed the stay. The convenience of having a limo driver meet us at the airport (and then take us back) was a great relief after a long plane trip from San Francisco. The location is very nicely situated away from the center of Rome but within an easy metro ride into the city. My husband and I were in Rome for the Italian Open and found that we could walk a rather easy 45 minute walk to the Foro Italico. Good exercise before and after a lot of tennis watching! I especially enjoyed being in a real Roman neighborhood. When we went to local restaurants, we were the only non-Italians usually. The neighborhood restauarants were very good (esp. Duke's). Vittoria is a gem. She took care of all our breakfasts and logistical needs...I agree with other reviewers: she is special and makes the place all the more worth staying at! The room was clean and suitable. As so often is the case in Italy, we could smell cigarette smoke wafting up through the window. As non-smokers this was troubling, but it's hard to avoid this in Rome. The floors are wood and noise travels readily. When other guests are polite and respectful, there is little problem, but this is not always the case. When we arrived, exhausted from our travels, we encountered other guests who were very loud with their t.v. and conversation. We used our sound machine to drown out the noise, but unfortunately, we were also too loud and were politely advised the next day not to use it again....There were subsequent outbursts of noise from other guests, but with ear plugs, one can generally block out the noise. And finally, the free Wi-fi was very convenient! All in all I recommend Suite Oriani.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: rose1030
Reviews.Content: Just looking at the review from the american lady and was shocked by her comments. We stayed here last year and the house & the room & location were perfect. The owner and his son made us very very welcome.The food was excellent. Looking to return to Rome in the next couple of years and we we will be going back to the Suite Oriani.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: rhs009
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Suite Oriani was a wonderful surprise. While very close to the Old City, it was in a quiet residential area where the only morning noises were birdsongs. We had a very helpful welcome from Alessandro, and other staff helped us plan an excursion to Tivoli. Our room was clean, well-appointed and complete with everything we needed for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful unique experience”
Reviews.Author: larisa7867
Reviews.Content: The stylish villa Suite Oriani has a good location in the quiet area of Rome really close to the old town due to bus and metro service. The owners and staff are warm and nice, relaxed and helpful people. The rooms are as they appear on the webpage: comfortable, stylish decorated with antique collection of furniture and the most wonderful bed I have ever slept! I forgot to ask Allessandro what kind of mattress was in the room I stayed at… After daily kilometers-long walks via Eternal City my legs and back refused to service me, but after sound sleep I felt as in youth full of strength and energy to see and enjoy again the artworks of Great Italian architects, sculptors and painters. The price is adequate to quality. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem away from the busy center”
Reviews.Author: MD_scubanut
Reviews.Content: My wife, mother and I stayed at Suite Oriani for four days in June 2010 and I must say that we were very pleased with everything about this place. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. The location is definitely away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist district in Rome, which is exactly what we wanted, but anyone who doesn't mind doing a bit of walking can get to any of the major tourist sites from the hotel. My mother, who is in her 70s and in good physical condition, had no difficulty walking to lovely locations like the Villa Borghese, Piazza del Popolo, the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, etc. We didn't want to be right in the middle of the tourist sites, but we found them very easy to get to from Suite Oriani. We had a lot of fun by just buying an all day bus pass and seeing where they went, which is by far the easiest way of seeing Rome at the street level. We found some really nice restaurants this way. We found the breakfast that is served to you in your room to be very filling and tasty. The hotel is very quiet at night. You may close the window shutters and your room will be completely dark, which is my preference for good sleep. The staff are all very friendly and will help you with any problem that you may have. Do not expect the staff to be waiting at the front desk at all hours. This is not that kind of place. The family who owns the property also live there and they need their time off as well. The only thing that Suite Oriani lacks is an outdoor sitting area for guests. We solved this problem by using Alessandro's desk on the front porch of hotel where we could drink our wine at night (thanks Alessandro!). He seemed not to mind. It would be nice to have a small table and some chairs somewhere where we could enjoy the evening air. Prior to our arrival in Rome, we were the victims of a pickpocket in Naples. Some cash and credit cards were liberated from us. I must thank Alessandro for being very helpful by assisting us with closing the credit card accounts. He allowed us to use his cell phone, laptop computer and Skype account to call the US for a problem with adding more minutes to our rented cell phone (Cellular Abroad, which I DO NOT recommend). Alessandro was very patient and kind with us. I can't understand the terrible review that was written by the lady from Ohio. Her review is simply is not accurate. For those who must remain connected to the Internet, wireless Internet access is available at no additional cost at Suite Oriani. We enjoyed our meals at Taverna Rossini (www.tavernarossini.it) at 54 Viale G. Rossini (Tel 06 84242903) and also at "La Pariolina" (Alessandro can direct you to this restaurant). There are many more restaurants, but these two places we enjoyed very much. A final note that is unrelated to Suite Oriani. Having a cell phone in Italy is very helpful, but I found Cellular Abroad to be a ripoff. It cost $125 to rent a phone for 2 weeks. We ran out of minutes during the pickpocket incident and the phone call cut off a just the wrong moment. It was very difficult to add more minutes to the phone, which is why I had to use Alessandro's Skype to call the US. Even the Skype representative had some difficulty adding the minutes. Finally, it cost me $24 dollars to add a balance of 10 Euro to the phone. Do the math if the exchange rate is 1 Euro For $1.25. By my calculation, I should have received about 19 Euro credit, but I only got 10 Euro and the other 9 Euro went to their profit. NICE! Buy a throwaway in Italy or temporarily add international service if you have a GSM phone (CDMA won't work in Italy), but stay away from Cellular Abroad. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Suite Oriani”
Reviews.Author: bettyhoops
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice, the room was lovely. Me, my mom and my aunt stayed only the last two days of our trip in Italy. What a pity! We enjoyed the beautiful sorroundings and the ease to go downtown by subway. Alessandro was super and very sweet, he's a lovely person, very helpful and assists everyone with everything. We would suggest Suite Oriani to everybody and can't wait to come back!!! Thank you Suite Oriani.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel stay I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: molby3
Reviews.Content: The owner of this establishment, Alessandro, is completely incorrigible and hostile. He threw myself and my elderly traveling companion who has difficulty walking over a miscommunication involving a limo ride w/o regard for our welfare or safety. In addition, he said he would not charge us for our stay but not only did he charge us, he charged us for nights we didn't even stay! He is deviant and salacious and fully untrustworthy. Also it is NOT close to central Rome. It an enormous flight of stairs, a bus ride and a subway ride from central Rome. I advise any traveler to BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Nimu
Reviews.Content: Suite Oriani was a highlight of my trip to Roma! Clean, fantastic location and in a very nice neighbourhood. Alessandro the owner and Isabella the housekeeper were gracious and wonderful. The underground to get to see the sights and sounds is but a stone throw away and in the evenings, taking a walk to the surrouding orianis restaurants etc that were not all 'touristy' was divine! When in Roma again. Unlike other hotels, the WIFI here is free and we were able to plan via the internet great events for each day. I will be sure to stay at the Suite Oriani again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Neighborhood, Inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: Boondoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three different B&Bs to get a sampling of various locations in Rome. The B&B itself was very nice. Service was excellent and we felt like we had our very own maid. She was quick to help us, called taxis and insisted they be pronto, made arrangements, and made us feel at home. The room was elegant, the bathroom large, the air conditioning refreshing. The neighborhood was quiet and the views charming. We were very close to the best restaurant we had in Rome - try La Scala just down the hill! This is a very upper class neighborhood and you can walk to great shopping as well. Despite all this, the location was a hassle. We tried to use public transportation in Rome, and others had said this was convenient. However, the nearby Metro station was closed for repairs at the time of our visit, so check on this. Getting here from the Colosseum involved riding Metro B, transferring to Metro A, then riding it to Piazza de Popolo, then getting on the Urban Train which is covered in graffiti and very dirty. This dropped us off past the closed station, so we had to then ride a bus to the neighborhood, then walk up the hill. You can avoid this last bus if the station is reopened, but it will still be something of a hassle on public transportation. Anyone saying this is only 'one Metro stop' on the reviews is not telling the truth. I wished we had used a taxi more, but this will had at least 10 Euro each direction to your stay at the Suite. They may want to reduce the room charge by 20 E or provide a coupon while the Metro is closed. If you don't mind using a taxi and being out of the city center, this will be a wonderful retreat for you, as there is nothing to complain about with the suite itself or the service. I took some off on cleanliness as the fancy pillows had some stains. We used the free WiFi to video chat back to the family in the States. We enjoyed a nice breakfast in our room, and felt very secure here. You will have a hard time finding better service or a more plush room.

Reviews.Title: “nice place, location too far from center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: giancarloNewYork
Reviews.Content: This place was rated well and was clean, quiet and the service good. However, it is really on the outskirts. Breakfast served in your room is all (Italian style) sugar, don't expect eggs or something healthy. You will have to take a bus or taxi to get into the city. I am a walker, hiker and you will need public transportation, which can add up if you take taxis. If you take the bus, you need to buy the ticket before you get on the bus and put the ticket in the machine on the bus. Ok place if you want to be away from it all but a problem if you just want to walk outside and begin touring Roma.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of relaxation in the midst of busy touring.”
Reviews.Author: owlone57
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by a very attentive and hospitable housekeeper. Isabella made sure we had everything we needed. Rooms are very clean, comfortable, quiet and a retreat after a day of sightseeing. Transport is convenient and Isabella makes sure you know how to use the transport and where to go for dinner. Breakfast is a lovely continental tray with fresh coffee in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lolly100
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Rome, and I would definatly recommend this hotel. It is only 1 metro stop from the main town. It is located in a quiet area with good local restaurants. I would recommend being picked up from the airport by a chauffer as there is not much difference in cost than using public transport. The hotel will arrange everything. The room was clean and pleasent with no noise. I would visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Oriani - Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: DavidandPaula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Suite Oriani for one night pre cruise and three nights post cruise in July 2007. Pre cruise we flew into Rome and travelled by train to Euclide, then walked to Suite Oriani. After this I would definitely recommend arranging a transfer from the airport As Suite Oriani seems to be on the highest point around and every direction of approach is uphill, when you are dragging a suitcase this is a major inconvenience. Also, we had booked many months in advance, with a view to the lovely garden rooms on the web site, but on arrival we found we had an upstairs room with a narrow spiral staircase to negotiate with the large cases already mentioned. The room however was superb, especially compared with the London hotel room we stayed in for the previous week. At night, sleeping with the french doors wide open we did not even notice any traffic noise. In the morning, the breakfast was adequate, not huge but I needed to diet anyway. After breakfast Alessandro rang for a taxi to take us to the Borghese Gallery. We booked out about lunch time for the trip to Civitavecchia to join the cruise. On our return from the cruise there was a bit of a mix up with rooms and we had one night in a very ordinary room before being moved to a better room for the remaining nights of our stay. The second room was almost as good as our room pre cruise and very comfortable. While Parioli may be considered a bit remote we found it an ideal compromise as the metro was close enough and very efficient. We soon found the quickest walking route to Euclide and local shops and without luggage the hills were not as daunting. On our last evening in Rome we used buses to travel to a restaurant for our final dinner in Rome, returning about midnight. The next morning was an early rise and transfer to the airport to fly home to Australia. There was a bit of a mix up with the time the transfer was required but we used the transfer organised by Aleesandro and once we were picked up the trip to the airport was very comfortable and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighborhood; no contact with fellow tourists”
Reviews.Author: drjj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed staying in the Parioli, one of the nicer "residential" neighborhoods of Rome. We had been to Rome a couple of times, but chose this location precisely because it was out of the center. The neighborhood has many very large, well kept houses from the 18th century, some still private homes, some now flats, some embassies etc. It's a nice walk down to the street with many restaurants (we liked L'Escala best by far). It's also a very pleasant walk (we thought) from the Suites through the Villa Borghese Parco and on down the Spanish Steps for wander around the historic center of Rome. Our Rome was large as was the modern bath. It had a couple of chairs at the breakfast table, but lacked an upholstered chair for reading etc. in the evening after a return from dining etc. It's a great alternative to the very high priced hotels of central Rome in many ways, but in one regard it is very lacking for travelers lilke us and that is the following: Breakfasts are only served in the room (by the every attentive and helpful Victoria). This has certain advantages, but also prohibits any friendly conversation with fellow touristssuch as one often finds in a nice B&B property . There is no common area to gather on the property. The garden was mentioned online to some degree when I checked out the property, but it is held privately by the on-property owners (the son is the manager and will help out in any way possible, if asked, but mainly we (and our friends, another couple) had contact primarily with Victoria. Thus, we four felt the great lack at the property is some sort of space for guests to either sit outside in clement and warm weather to enjoy a drink and conversation or an inside lounge for the same purpose, including sharing breakfast time at will.

Reviews.Title: “A Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: jhasko
Reviews.Content: Our stay at he Suite Orani was like a scene from a motion picture. Clean and well appointed furnishings and an in room breakfast you enjoy from your balcony view of the gardens below. The traffic of Rome is replaced by the morning songbirds and yet you are a quick metro ride to anywhere in Rome. Our hosts Alessandro and staff enhanced our stay with helpful suggestions on restaurnats and places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Italian neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Niagaranomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 3 nights with another couple as part of a 16 day Italian holiday and were very pleased with Suite Oriani. Alessandro and Vittoria were extremely helpful in providing maps , directions and information to help us with our stay. We were outside of the old town but a short walk to the subway took us cheaply to any part of the city we wanted. By staying here we feel we got much more for our Euros and 2 of the 3 evenings enjoyed local restaurants seldom frequented by tourists - and our meals were excellent. The other evening we ate in Piazza Navonna and it was the most expensive meal of our whole trip. Our rooms were immaculate and spacious and quiet. The breakfasts were typical but the quantity let us take fruit and cookie snacks for later in the day.We would certainly recommend Oriani to others.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandKiwiBird
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful peaceful place to stay, out of the maddening crownds of Rome. Very helpful staff, rooms amazing, large, we had a windows opening out onto lovely garden views with the sound of birds, just lovely, Lovely Italian breakfeast, very clean room. Chaffuer service fantastic. Very close to local restuarants, a short walk to Villa Borghesse What more could you want in Rome. Very reasonably priced Situated amongst a number of Embassys. You feel like a local We just loved it Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place, excellent people, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: kil
Reviews.Content: Excellent place, excellent people, excellent location. Typical italian breakfast served every day in the room. Lovely neighborhood. Excellent restaurants nearby. 15 minutes by metro to the centre (one metro stop). Rooms nice decorated. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ettoretermes
Reviews.Content: It was truly a wonerful stay! Suite Oriani is one of the most charming hotels I have ever stayed in! With a beautifully kept garden and the sweetest rooms! They were very clean and peaceful, they even offered Internet access! The service and attention was above average, we were provided a wonderful Italian breakfast with several options to pick from, they even catered to the temperature of our coffee!! The staff was very sweet and helpful, they provided maps and information, and recommended the best restaurants in the area. The location itself was great, in an upscale neighborhood and within walking distance to the metro station which takes you right into the old town. Definitely excellent value for it's price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so good than I expected”
Reviews.Author: rat22
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in Dec. 1. The prices are different for different dates. it's fine with me as some excellent B&B also have this practise. 2. The staff is not very helpful. I just felt they don't want us to brother them. No intercom/ phone provided. You could find them if you have any problem. 3. Breakfast is terrible. Cool and least. 4. Traffic is not good enough. If you get there by private / taxi. It's ok, if by metro, no way. You have to change to a terrible train from a major metro station. But the frequency of the train is terrible. I wait for 45 mins for a train. 5. Anyway, the good is decoration / it's clean. No more, don't expect any services even you paid for euro160 per night. 6. But the restaurant they suggested is good, worth enough. 7. I would recommend it if you get there by private car and have your own breakfast, if the rate is less than euro80 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Oriani”
Reviews.Author: tailorswife
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girl's week end in Rome. Booked Suite Oriana on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews. We were not disappointed. We found the location ideal - one metro stop away from the centre in a residential area away from the nuisance street vendors and expensive restaurants. Local restaurants were reasonably priced, good quality and a short stroll away from the accommodation. The welcome chat complete with maps and handy tips was excellent as was the reliability of the limo service. The only thing I missed was tea/coffee making but the mini bar was adequately stocked and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: crys209
Reviews.Content: The online reservation was very reliable, a confirmation email was sent immediately. The hotel offered a limo service which was a wonderful option after a long flight from the U.S. The hotel was located just one metro stop outside of down town with many restaurants within walking distance. The hotel itself was very beautiful and located in an ancient villa. The rooms were very clean and charming decorated with antique furniture and there was a fresh lemon and rose sent that carried throughout the rooms. A typical Italian breakfast was served in the room each morning. Federica, the owner, was a wonderful help! She provided a lot of useful information for getting around the city. The sweet and beautiful Renata and Victoria were also very kind and friendly. Overall a wonderful experience! I strongly recommend a stay at this town house!

Reviews.Title: “Fine and clean Suite Oriani”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Polo0815
Reviews.Content: The Suite Oriani is a cosy, modern, quiet, very clean place to stay in Rome. It is a 5 minutes walk away from the train station Euclide and appr. 40 minutes walk from the city center. Close to Suite Oriani were some quite good non-touristy restaurants. The owner speaks english very well, he had some information for tourists available. The breakfast is Italian style, additional requests for breakfast will be fulfiled. We had two double rooms incl. bathroom each. The rooms and their bathrooms were very clean and cleaned every day incl. fresh towels. Hair dryers were available. The beds were very comfortable. TV, minibar and telephone were available. A chauffeur service is offered from and to the airport (FCO) for 60 Euros per ride. The train plus metro to the hotel is 12,50 Euros. If you are more than 3 persons, we recommend to use the chauffeur service. Excellent accommodation in Rome for the price. We all would come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Peaceful Haven”
Reviews.Author: twotickets
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Italy and spent 3 nights at the beautiful Suite Oriani. We did not take Allesandro up on his offer of a transfer from the airport and found the train trip from Fiumicino to be quick, comfortable and easy. However we were cheated by the taxi diver from the Termini - fellow travellers beware - make sure they turn the meter on - a typical ploy is to neglect that little detail and charge what they like. (A typical fare from the termini to Suite Oriani should not be more than 12-15 Euro - we got gouged for 35!) However, none of that was Suite Oriani's fault and armed with Allessandro's cautions on the subject, we were not overcharged again on two subsequent taxi trips to the hotel at the end of busy days. The hotel is truly a peaceful haven in a lovely neighbourhood. My husband, an architect, went mad for the fabulous art deco and art nouveau buildings on the surrounding streets (of which Suite Oriani is a stunning example of the latter). I think we may have had one on the smallest rooms in the house, (on the ground floor) but it was not cramped in the least. It was so quiet that we thought we were the only guests in the place until we found others on the morning we were checking out. The showerroom was the one that a previous reviewer has included a picture of and has complained about. Yes, it was a bit cramped but it was beautifully finished in classic Italian style. The water temperature and pressure was never a problem during our stay and I used the shower very early. Being a British/Canadian couple, we might have left out the bidet if we had been designing that showerroom to give a bit more room but of course understand that bidets are highly regarded in Italy. I am not complaining about it. The bed was firm and comfortable and the window stayed open throughout our stay - we enjoyed hot and sunny days and pleasantly cool nights. So we did not try the aircon but it looked up-to-date and in good condition. Breakfast - previous reviewers have commented on lukewarm Capucino and I would tend to agree but would add that as we usually had further capucinos while out and about, we ALWAYS found them to be lukewarm in cafes as well so won't hold this against Suite Oriani. Allessandro was at pains to explain that the breakfast was typically Italian and we found it to be so in later hotels we stayed at. When in Rome, etc. If you want a full English breakfast, come to England. We would definitely go back there and unreservedly recommend it to fellow travellers. Only thing is I wished we had made sure we got a room with a balcony - the other room on the ground floor has one and further ones upstairs do as well. On my next visit I will definitely stipulate that. We had two dinners in local restaurants, La Scala and Pariolini Pizzeria - both were great and get our recommendation. No tourist menus here. We felt very safe walking around this lovely neighbourhood and found the public transportation to the sites of Rome to be perfectly straighforward and compared to what we pay here in London a fantastic bargain at 1 Euro per trip.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this World! Amazing Find.”
Reviews.Author: Beony
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, the staff was extremely pleasant and friendly. Alessandro the owner went out of his way to make our hotel experience truly wonderful. He recomended several local restaurants away from the tourist madhouses that one can easily find in Rome. The room we stayed in was clean and cozy. The breakfast was delivered into our room by Renata who was friendly (and beautiful). The area is very safe and many embassys from all over the world. You can walk to Villa Borghese in 15 minutes. It feels more like a private villa than a Hotel in every sense. Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Worth leaving the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: scottgood1
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay on the first part of our trip to Italy. North of the Villa Borghese, the best way to get there is via the Roma Nord metro line from the Flaminio station, then a short hike up a hilly street (Barnaba Oriani). One night we stayed out a little late and took a taxi from Piazza Navona; believe that was about 10 euros. The room was spacious with a king-size bed, large walk-in closet, mini-fridge (empty for us to stock ourselves as we wanted), french doors opening to a quiet garden area and a modern, well-equipped bathroom. The shower was small, as were all the others to follow at other hotels; so be it. The bed was comfy, the AC worked great and they had a plug by the headboard--important for me, since I've got a CPAP machine I lug around for sleep apnea. The staff were super-friendly, bringing a great breakfast to the room each AM. Toasted almond croissant, juice, yogurt, some bread, nutella and cappucino. All in all, a great stay; will stay here again when in Rome. Will post a photo of our room if I've got time later.

Reviews.Title: “Words Cannot Describe How Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 3JLs
Reviews.Content: There are so many wonderful memories we have about our stay at Suite Oriani during May 2007. Being first time travelers to Europe, it was our first trip to Rome and it was the trip that included the wedding of our first and eldest son. When traveling in the United States, we have always stayed at bed and breakfast inns. So we did not want to say at a hotel in central Rome. Booking our accommodations without the aid of a travel agent, we were impressed with the information regarding Suite Oriani on one of the many travel websites. Upon booking our reservations, four months in advance, with the travel website, we were contacted via email by Allessandro, the owner of Suite Oriani, the following day. Being first time travelers to Rome, we had numerous questions concerning our trip. Allessandro answered our many calls, and emails promptly and also offered advice. This advice included arranging transport from the FCO airport to Suite Oriani. Arriving in Rome, we met with difficulty concerning delays in our airline and the lost of our luggage. Being unable to use our cell phone in the FCO airport made it impossible to contact Alessandro concerning our situation. After searching and waiting one hour for our luggage, we departed the luggage area without our luggage and expecting our limo to have left without us. To our surprise, our driver was patiently waiting for us holding a sign bearing our name. Seeing him was the highlight of our arrival in Rome after the dismay caused by our airline(name not to be mentioned). Our driver listened patiently to our tale of woe as he directed us to our limo. After a pleasant drive through Rome, we arrived at Suite Oriani. Our driver escorted us to our room where we were met by Allessandro. Besides being polite and cordial, Allessandro told us general information in regard to the residental area where we were staying, as well as, directions(and a map) to help navigate Rome. He was very concerned about our experience at the airport and offered to help the following day with locating our luggage, without our asking for his assistance. Our room was everything we imagined and more! It was spacious, tidy, airy, and comfortable. The bath was larger than we expected given the information regarding European baths on the web. As to the hot water mentioned in other reviews, we never experienced any problem with the water at any time of the day during our stay. With Allessandro's recommendation, we dined our first evening at La Scala, a local restaurant, within walking distance of Suite Oriani. It was one of the best meals we had while in Rome! The waiter was very courteous and helpful in making our first dining experience in Rome wonderful! We awoke our first morning in Rome after a comfortable night's rest to fresh scents of lemon trees, of magnolia blossoms, and of floral scents drifting through the balcony doors. Having a good night's sleep with the balcony doors ajar (as air conditioning can be optional in Rome due to its climate, but there if needed), we awoke refreshed. Shortly, a knock at our door, Allessandro's assistant arrived with a tray of hot cappuccinos, croissants, fresh butter, toast, nutella, fresh juice, yogart, and Italian cookies. This would be our daily experience each and every morning at Suite Oriani. Such wonderful memories! Each day, we walked a short distance to the subway that we would take to downtown Rome to tour the sights. The website is correct in stating that the subway is accessible by walking a short distance. All the websites state that walking to see the sights is the preferred way. This is one of the reasons we enjoyed staying at Suite Oriani, we could easily walk to the subway-travel closer to Rome, see the sights, return by subway, and enjoy a pleasant "fragrance filled" walk back to Suite Oriani. Each evening we returned to a room that was tidy and clean and relax in a quiet and tranquil atmosphere. Then, if we chose, walk through the neighborhood that is very safe to nearby restaurants. Also, to our surprise and relief, each evening we were met by Allessandro who would update us on his communication with our airline and the status of our lost luggage- we also had been in touch with the airline during the day. It really was a nice experience for us that Allessandro assisted with our situation without our asking. He really went beyond our expectations of an innkeeper! Sadly, the day of our departure arrived, still without our luggage,we would have to leave Rome for the Amalifi coast and the weddding of our son. Our train departed at 12:45 PM. At this point , Allessandro and his assistant were invaluable as it was their phonecalls and insistance, with the airlines, not ours due to the lanugage barrier, that our luggage was delivered at 12:15 PM to the gates of Suite Oriani. Simultaneously, Allessandro was on his phone communicating with our transportation and we were off to board our train for Naples. If you have the good fortune of traveling to Rome, you will enjoy staying at Suite Oriani!! It meets and exceeds the information offered by their website. We hope to return to Rome in our future and when we do, we will return to Suite Oriani!! Thank-you Allessandro for such wonderful memories!!

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water Before 7:30am!!!”
Reviews.Author: BensMom
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that we booked this hotel five months in advance going on the reviews from previous guests of this hotel. We were bewildered as our stay went on, by the comments made by other guests. For instance, the breakfasts - they are horrible, to say the least! Coffee at room temperature, melba toast, fruit punch from a powder mix and day old sticky croissants. It's substandard , no fruit, nothing at all special. This starchy breakfast only leaves you with a bottomed out feeling later in the morning. We received one pat of butter our first morning (there were three of us) and no butter the remaining three mornings. The owners eat well, as we smelled their breakfasts cooking each morning!! Our triple room was a queen size bed (foam mattress, lumpy pillows) and a roll away bed, not big enough for a child over the age of 12. Our son is an adult and the owner, Alessandro, was made aware of this when we booked. Not only that, the shower was so small, you couldn't properly wash, and we are slim people. The water pressure was nonexistant. The shower drain was VERY slow and worst yet, NO HOT WATER BEFORE 7:30AM!!!! Tough luck to anyone wanting to get ready early and head into Rome to tour, which, let's face it, is everyone who stays here as a guest. For insatnce, a lot of organised tours begin at 9am. Also, leaving the windows open at night was out of the question, since the neighbors and who ever lives down below the room we were in played loud music each night until 2am and the cooking odors drifted in at all hours of the night, as well. We read the previous review about being moved to another hotel and worried that would happen to us, but, luckily it didn't. We were in regular contact with Alessandro prior to the trip, yet he did not make himself known at all throughout our four night stay! Renalto, the housekeeper, said we would be lucky to see him at all. Renalto does her best, but seems she does everything including taking the payment at the end of our stay. She is a bit stressed at times. She got a little testy at the start of our stay, but seemed okay after that. The hotel is easy to get to (two trains) after you figure out the confusing map. The neighborhood is a bit iffy, as far as litter and grafitti and sits outside the Embassy area. The next time we go to Rome, we will not be staying at Suite Oriani. The website is impressive, but like the previous review, beware! La Scala was nice, we ate there our first night, but be careful with the restaurants/cafe's in Rome, as the take out charge for food and the sit in charge is completely different!! We were charged 39 Euro for three sandwiches, and three coffees at a cafe near the Vatican. They charged us double to bring it to our table!!! We were shocked, but who can you complain to when most don't speak English and we don't speak or read Italian. The price lists are not generally displayed, so ask the price before ordering anything. The venders charge 4 Euros for a bottle of soda. BEWARE!!

Reviews.Title: “I believed the previous reviews, this is my version”
Reviews.Author: captainkelly
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 months in advance & arranged for the Oriani limousine service to collect us at the airport, there was disbelief when I phoned Oriani to inform them he wasn't there, silly me, he's there, just not holding my name, (perhaps that’s why I didn't see him?) but another person's going to Oriani, we were told to wait as another driver was coming for us, 20 mins later, a driver that was there all along, puts the name he had been holding away & takes us! sorry if you were the other person The bathroom was far too small for items in there, I sat on the toilet, knees touching shower door . Shower had less pressure than a watering can Very nice picturesque clean room, bit noisy, I was awoken every morning at 6am, someone in same building opening outside window shutters with 3 large fast pulls & then a thump. Then there's an invisible water feature; a trickling noise, which really sounds like water, is going to appear. There are a number of dogs in the area, some large, that enjoy a conversation Breakfast is nice & plentiful, apart from the coffee only being lukewarm. The “MINI BAR” this was 2 bottles of warm water on a tray on the table with 2 glasses, PRICELESS Tv is Italian only, it would have been nice to see some news as we followed Bush into Rome (find out who he's upsetting today) Oriani is situated on a hill, so after a hard day of sightseeing, you will be walking up an incline from the local metro station (My wife has asthma so we noticed it more) Considering the exclusive area, you will also be walking on very poorly maintained pavements with plenty of obstacles in the shape of dog [--], scooters & cars (the latter amusingly unable to park in a space available, so they park with there bonnet on the said pavement). Also buildings with drives, the cars are allowed to park blocking pavement. You don't want to spend too much time in the road though, as the drivers get target fixation. In need of some good food on arrival at Oriani, we were pointed in the direction of La Scalla Ristorante (we were not aware of the class differences in Italian restaurants), we didn’t get good Italian food, nor did we get good service, bordering on racial discrimination. La Pariolina Pizzeria was the complete opposite, FANTASTIC, good variety of great well cooked meals, deserts that we still dream about & excellent friendly service, very warm busy atmosphere. We considered it was worth returning to Rome for this experience alone. “HIGH QUALITY ROOM SERVICE” The place appeared empty of staff, the only way we found of calling the room service was to go outside & press the entry buzzer! We never got to meet the wonderful Alessandro, only a smiley maid who turned out to be more than that. At no point was we asked whether we liked the room etc. etc. the longest conversation we had with her was on the penultimate day when the smile disappeared & we found out the limo wasn’t organised for our departure. She was not interested in the copies of the emails with Alessandro from 4 months earlier, confirming everything including our flight details. Needless to say our breakfast coffee was cold on this day. And to add insult to injury, on return home, we find the prices listed for the dates we were there have been reduced by 20 Euro per day

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suite!”
Reviews.Author: sarahgurl00
Reviews.Content: Suite Oriani was a nice, calm stay in such a busy city! Rome was like the NY of Italy and Suite Oriani was a nice place to come back to every night. The room was very large and nice with a little balcony. The bathroom was also very large and pretty luxurious for European standards in my opinion. Breakfast in the morning was wonderful and the staff were just darling. The lady that brought us breakfast also cleaned the rooms, and checked us out so it was very nice to have one nice person be able to handle everything. She also arranged transportation for us and spoke and understood English very well. The metro was pretty close, but the line it was on was a little bit shabby, meaning once we got one stop over, to the Red line, the trains were a little nicer and better taken care of. But this is understandable since our Green line was more into the residential area. The Suite is in an upscale residential area and it felt very safe to walk to from the metro in the evening. Overall it was a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: ratkarth
Reviews.Content: what an amazing find a lovely town house tastefuly furnished although on the outskirts of town, it is VERY easy to get into the heart of rome and the owner is more than happy to help you with this. this is my 2nd visit to rome and staying here was the best move ever as not only acted as a great place for sightseeing but also meant you were living in an area with real italian people none of that substandard "menu touristique" rubbish, all the restuarants in the area were brilliant and authenticly italian, you have to try la'scalia a 2 min walk and the 2nd best italian meal i have ever tasted (the best is reserved for a pizza served in naples but thats another story)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: djplaymate
Reviews.Content: I would definately stay here again. It was a short train trip to the city and the surrounding monuments, as well as being in a quiet and safe area. Alessandro and Renata were lovely hosts and although the room we stayed in (piccolo suite) was alot smaller then expected it was still very comfortable. However If you plan to hang out and relax in your room rather than being out to see the city during the days or dining out at nights, then be sure to get one of the larger suites. Very happy Suite Oriani vistor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Oriani Suite”
Reviews.Author: ilean75
Reviews.Content: We have really enjoyed the Oriani Suite. The rooms were very clean and nice decorated. The bed & breakfast facilities and staff were wonderful, and great nice italian restaurants within ten minutes by walk. Everything is immaculated. It's not walking distance too much. You need to take the metro (or walk). It is just one stop away from Piazza del Popolo which is a good place to start walking to visit the old city. The Oriani Suite is in the Parioli district, very safe and elegant. We'll be very happy to come back again, and recommend to everyone who wants to visit Rome. Thank you very much Oriani!!!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Suite Oriani!”
Reviews.Author: Litlove39
Reviews.Content: Suite Oriani was a wonderful haven for two jet-lagging Americans who had never traveled to Italy. As others have mentioned, it is in an upscale neighborhood within close walking distance to several good restaurants and some nice shopping, albeit a metro stop or three from the heart of the city. The Villa Borghese, a museum/park complex worth taking a day to relax in, is the closest major site to Suite Oriani. The Via Veneto is just beyond the Villa Borghese. Suite Oriani is lovely and secure. Our room was very clean, attractively decorated and bathed in natural light. We even had a walk-in closet where we could store and hang our belongings, and a mini-frig for drinks or snacks. Breakfast is served every morning in your room. Wireless internet is available without charge upon request (a big plus in my opinion). The entire atmosphere of the Villa is cozy and relaxing, almost like one is renting a small apartment away from the frenetic city. The rooms are as lovely in reality as they are depicted on the internet, and the air-conditioning works very well. Alessandro can tell you the interesting history of the villa. Rome can be daunting, so it was extremely helpful having a native like Alessandro giving us the “wherewithal.” In fact, Alessandro and Renata were among the kind people who became memorable as our 8-week journey progressed. I can’t imagine a more pleasant way to be baptized into the energy and idiosyncrasies of Rome than to anchor your visit at the Suite Oriani.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay. This is a fantastic little hotel in a perfect location for touring Rome. The staff (Alessandro&Renata) could not have been more helpful and the hotel is one of the cleanest i have ever stayed in. Definately recommended. Continental Breakfast delivered to room every morning was a lovely touch. i have stayed in a lot of hotels and have not been impressed until now. At the Suite Oriani we had a stylish, spacious and very comfortable spotless room. The bathroom sparkled every day, not just on the day of arrival. The neighborhood are really nice and safe, green and quiet, with a lot of great restaurants, chic shops. Suite Oriani is a 2 minute walk away from the nearest underground so we could get to anywhere in Rome in approx 1o mins. A perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oriani a paradise”
Reviews.Author: uccelliluna
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at Suite Oriani in early March. Later in the week we moved to a hotel near the Campo dei Fiori where we had made previous reservations and I was sorry to move! Suite Oriani is like living in a palazzo--spacious, high-ceilinged rooms, unbelievably quiet and green, north of the Villa Borghese. The only drawback was that it was a little hard to get to and from the hotel. It is only one Metro stop (Euclide) on the B line from Flaminio, and if this were the Paris Metro it would have been no problem. Even so, I felt as if I were living in a dream, an Italian paradise. I would strongly recommend to anyone visiting Rome to spend at least some of your time here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, spotless, peaceful and friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my trip in Rome and was so thankful that I stayed here! Alessandro was there to welcome me after such a long trip from the States. I was travelling alone and Alessandro was helpful in giving me train and map information. He told me how to get my bearings in Rome. The suite that I stayed in was BEAUTIFUL! It was large with my own private balcony and had beautiful antique furniture. The bathroom was spotless as was the entire suite. Renata cleans your suite so well that you probably can eat off the floors!!! Unlike most hotels in the touristy areas, one can get a peaceful night's sleep and wake up to birds chiriping and not to mention a delicious breakfast that is served right in your room. Renata, hands down, can make the best cup of cappucinno on this planet! She is also helpful as well and so sweet! To stay here was a treat! The rooms look just like they do in the photos and not to mention the whole place smelled so fresh! Alessandro also arranges a transportation for you if you should need it! I will definitely come back here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Suite Oriani
HotelInfo.Address: Via Barnaba Oriani, 92, 00197 Rome, Italy
